DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numerical value that represents the assessment of the circulatory status of a neonate, as a component of the APGAR test.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing._A component of the APGAR score, it is the numerical value assigned to an assessment of the circulatory status of a neonate. 0 = no pulse; 1 = rate less than 100 beats per minute; 2 = rate greater than 100 beats per minute.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing.

Concepts.definition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing.

Property.preferredDefinition: A component of the APGAR score, it is the numerical value assigned to an assessment of the circulatory status of a neonate. 0 = no pulse; 1 = rate less than 100 beats per minute; 2 = rate greater than 100 beats per minute.

Concepts.definition: A component of the Apgar score, it is the numerical value assigned to an assessment of the circulatory status of a neonate. 0 = no pulse; 1 = rate less than 100 beats per minute; 2 = rate greater than 100 beats per minute.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/20/10 Released Newborn Exam DECs per VCDE request; NCIHD context.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing._The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.: The rhythmic wave within the arteries occurring with each contraction of the left ventricle. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
The rhythmic wave within the arteries occurring with each contraction of the left ventricle.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Rate Less Than 100 Beats per Minute

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Rate Less Than 100 Beats per Minute
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::100: The number of heartbeats measured per minute time.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The number of heartbeats measured per minute time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Rate Greater Than 100 Beats per Minute

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Rate Greater Than 100 Beats per Minute
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::100: The number of heartbeats measured per minute time.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The number of heartbeats measured per minute time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
